sentence.Network_en: Argentina came to a virtual standstill while the game was being played.
sentence.Network_cn: 在比赛进行的时候，阿根廷全国几乎陷入了停顿状态。

sentence.Network_en: Journalists said there was a virtual news blackout about the rally.
sentence.Network_cn: 记者们说有关这场集会的新闻实际上被封锁了。

sentence.Network_en: One day virtual reality will revolutionize the entertainment industry.
sentence.Network_cn: 有一天虚拟现实将使娱乐业发生革命性的变化。

list.abs: 虚拟现实（Virtual reality）与模拟现实（Simulated reality），一字之差，很容易引起混淆。 不少人把虚拟现实与模拟现实混为一谈。
考研英语结合实际美词一览 -考研英语 ... e-commerce( 电子商务) virtual life( 虚拟生活) information era( 信息时代).
虚拟内存（Virtual Memory） 是指计算机呈现出要比实际拥有的内存大得多的内存量。因此它允许程序员编制并运行比实际系统拥有 …
虚拟机（Virtual Machine）指通过软件模拟的具有完整硬件系统功能的、运行在一个完全隔离环境中的完整计算机系统。目录定义虚 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (also in the sense 'possessing certain virtues'): from medieval Latin virtualis, from Latin virtus 'virtue', suggested by late Latin virtuosus

entry.tran: 几乎的;实际上的;事实上的
entry.def: You can use virtual to  indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true.

example.ex: Argentina came to a virtual standstill while the game was being played...
example.tran: 在比赛进行的时候，阿根廷全国几乎陷入了停顿状态。

example.ex: He claimed to be a virtual prisoner in his own home.
example.tran: 他说自己在家里简直就像是个囚犯。

entry.def: Virtual objects and activities are generated by a computer  to simulate real objects and activities.

example.ex: Up to four players can compete in a virtual world of role playing...
example.tran: 最多可以有4个玩家在一个虚拟世界中扮演角色互相拼杀。

example.ex: This is a virtual shopping centre offering visitors entry to a clutch of well-known etailers without going to their different websites.
example.tran: 这是一个虚拟的购物中心，访问者在此就可以浏览很多著名的网上零售店铺，而无需分别访问它们各自的网站。

means.word_mean: 1. being actually such in almost every respect;

sentences.sentence: "the once elegant temple lay in virtual ruin"

means.word_mean: 2. being such in essence or effect though not in actual fact;

auth_sentence.content: Ms. Davis is treated here as a virtual saint.
auth_sentence.res_content: Ms. Davis is treated here as a virtual saint.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ms. Davis is treated here as a virtual saint.

auth_sentence.content: Why does one virtual team thrive while another stumbles?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why does one virtual team thrive while another stumbles?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Why does one virtual team thrive while another stumbles?

auth_sentence.content: Mr. Richman described the app as a virtual tour.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr. Richman described the app as a virtual tour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr. Richman described the app as a virtual tour.

Sentence.sentence: My colleagues and I are studying something called augmented reality (a field of computer research dealing with the combination of real-world and virtual reality)," said Christopher Dede, professor in learning technologies at Harvard University, "Alien Contact," for example, is an exercise developed for middle-school students who use hand-held devices that can determine their location.
These "thought experiments" were pages of calculations signed and submitted to the prestigious journal Annalen der Physik by a virtual unknown.

means.word_mean: 实质上的, 事实上的, 实际上的, 很接近的, 几乎…的

sentences.en: This reply is a virtual acceptance of our offer.
sentences.cn: 这一回答实质上是接受了我们的建议。

sentences.en: Over the years, he's picked off his competitors so that he now has a virtual monopoly.
sentences.cn: 几年来, 他一个一个地战胜了他的竞争对手, 现已成了实际垄断者。

jushi.english: Over the years, he's picked off his competitors so that he now has a virtual monopoly.
jushi.chinese: 几年来,他一个一个地战胜了他的竞争对手,现已实际上成了垄断者。
